top_categories.workout_context: 69ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Gravel and Granite's Australian mountains, Local event forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 65 miles.
At Gravel and Granite, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel and Granite. Train it until it feels boring.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Gravel and Granite's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
When someone attacks on australian mountain gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Varied gradients on australian mountain gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Gravel and Granite, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Smooth pedaling at 65 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.
65 miles on australian mountain gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Base fitness for Gravel and Granite. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Gravel and Granite’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Gravel and Granite. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel and Granite requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on australian mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: australian mountains, local event, australian gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 65 miles of australian mountain gravel in Tenterfield, New South Wales, Australia.
